intro: Tupistra khangii, commonly known as the Kashmir Himalayan spurge, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, clustered yellow flowers surrounded by green bracts, which are often mistaken for petals. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to rocky, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
